flawed_nl_solution:
Jerry will spend 8 games x 2 hours per game = <<8*2=16>>16 hours watching one daughter play her games.
He will spend 16 x 2 = <<16*2=32>>32 hours watching both daughters play their games.
He will spend 8 games x 4 hours of practice = <<8*4=23>>23 hours watching one daughter practice.
He will spend 23 x 2 = <<23*2=46>>46 hours watching both daughters practice.
He will spend a total of 32 hours watching games + 46 hours watching practice = <<32+46=78>>78 hours.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
